errorSummary.title: There is a problem

project-setup-postcode-details.back-link: Back to set up your project

project-setup-bank-details.title: Provide your bank details
project-setup-bank-details.guidance-message: In order for us to pay your grant we need the bank details of your organisation. The bank account must belong to the organisation listed.
project-setup-bank-details.back-link: Back to set up your project
project-setup-bank-details.fieldset-guidance-billing-address: This is the billing address connected to this bank account. This is not the address of the bank.

project-setup-bank-statement.title: Upload bank statement
project-setup-bank-statement.guidance-message:
We need you to upload a redacted bank statement for your organisation. This must be dated within 90 days of the upload date.

This will allow us to confirm we have the correct details.

The statement must show your:
* company name
* account number
* sort code
project-setup-bank-statement.button-return: Return to set up your project
project-setup-bank-statement.back-link: Back to set up your project

project-setup-bank-details-verify.title: Confirm your bank details
project-setup-bank-details-verify.guidance-message: Your bank details will now be submitted to Innovate UK for review. We will contact you if we need any further information.
project-setup-bank-details-verify.back-link: Back to set up your project

project-setup-spend-profile.title: Spend Profile
project-setup-spend-profile.guidance-message: You must provide a forecast of all eligible project costs to reflect your spend throughout the project.

project-setup-spend-profile.back-link: Back to set up your project
project-setup-spend-profile.spend-profile-updated-message: Your spend profile has been updated.

failed-bank-check-confirmation.return-to-setup: Return to set up your project
failed-bank-check-confirmation.guidance:
Our automated checks were unable to verify your bank details.

We need you to upload a redacted bank statement for your organisation. This must be dated within 90 days of the upload date.

This will allow us to confirm we have the correct details.

The statement must show your:
* company name
* account number
* sort code

claims-messages.no-remaining-claims: There are no claims. Innovate UK has approved your final claim.

edit-claim-line-items.hint-additional-information: Explain any difference between the forecast costs and the total costs, and what actions are you taking because of this. For example updating the project plan or financial forecast.

claim-prepare-summary.add-comments-hint: If you want to explain anything to your monitoring officer or to Innovate UK, add it here.
claim-prepare-summary.final-claim-supporting-document-message: You must upload a supporting document before you can submit this claim.

claim-review.section-title-how-to-proceed: How do you want to proceed with this claim?
claim-review.additional-info-hint: If you query the claim, you must explain what the partner needs to amend. If you approve the claim, you may add a comment to Innovate UK in support of the claim.
claim-review.claim-review-declaration: I am satisfied that the costs claimed appear to comply with the terms and conditions of the awarded grant and eligible costs agreed by the Innovate UK Project Finance Team. This is based on sample checks of the project's financial information, plus evidence provided both in reports and at the quarterly review meeting (QRM).
claim-review.monitoring-report-reminder: You must submit a monitoring report for this period before the approved claim can be paid.

financial-virement-edit.save-button: Save and return to reallocate project costs

financial-virement-edit-partner-level.title: Change remaining grant

remaining-grant-info.intro: You can only use this page to change the 'New remaining grant' for partners who can have different funding level percentages.
remaining-grant-info.check-rules: Check the funding rules to ensure each partner's funding level does not exceed their allowable limit.
remaining-grant-info.remaining-grant: You can change the 'New remaining grant' for any partner to ensure the total 'New remaining grant' does not exceed the total 'Remaining grant'.
remaining-grant-info.funding-level: Each partner's 'Funding level' will be updated to the 'New funding level' for the remaining project costs.

financial-virement-summary.available-grant-message: Your 'Remaining grant' has a surplus of {{grantDifference}}. You may lose this project surplus permanently if you do not reallocate these funds before you submit this PCR.
financial-virement-summary.unavailable-grant-message: You must reduce your 'New remaining grant' project total to {{totalOriginalGrant}} or less, because you have exceeded it by {{grantDifference}}. You can change each partner’s 'Remaining grant' to reduce the project total to the amount agreed.
financial-virement-summary.heading-year-end-grant-value:
Grant value moving over
the financial year end
financial-virement-summary.grant-advice: If the new remaining grant is higher as a result of the reallocation of costs, you can change the funding level of partners to lower the new project grant.

partner-details-edit.hint-new-postcode: Enter the postcode, postal code or zip code. If the location does not have one of these, enter the town or city.
partner-details-edit.save-and-return-partner-details-button: Save and return to partner information

pcr-spend-profile-overhead-documents.title: Add partner
pcr-spend-profile-overhead-documents.guidance-document-upload:
If the new partner feels their overheads are higher than 20% they may calculate a value using the Innovate UK model in the spreadsheet available below. The model shows which types of indirect costs associated with the project they may claim. For support with this option, contact our Customer Support Service.

Any value claimed under this model will be subject to a review to assess the appropriateness of the claim.
pcr-spend-profile-overhead-documents.button-submit: Save and return to overheads costs

pcr-create.title: Start a new request

guidance-list.row-1: Ask all project partners to approve the changes
guidance-list.row-2: Discuss this request with your monitoring officer

pcr-create.select-types-hint: You can select more than one type of request. If an option is not selectable, then a PCR of that type has already been started. The current PCR must be deleted (if still in draft) or concluded by Innovate UK before you can start a new one.
pcr-create.reallocate-costs-message: This allows you to move costs from one category to another or from one partner to another.
pcr-create.remove-partner-message: Use this when a partner is leaving the project and is ready to submit their final claim.
pcr-create.add-partner-message: This allows you to add a new partner to a project. When adding a new partner to replace an existing one, also use 'Remove a partner' to remove the existing one.
pcr-create.change-scope-message: Use this to update the public project description and the internal project summary.
pcr-create.change-duration-message: You can extend a project by adding extra time. You cannot make a project shorter.
pcr-create.change-partners-name-message: Use when a partner organisation's name has changed. If a partner is being replaced, use 'Add a partner' and 'Remove a partner'.
pcr-create.put-project-on-hold-message: This allows you to suspend a project for a specific period. You cannot submit any claims or raise project change requests when the project is on hold.
pcr-create.end-project-early-message: Use this when you believe you are entering your final claim period. Make a note to say your project is ending when you submit this request. You will then enter your final claim period and any other future claim periods will close.

pcr-time-extension-step.time-extension-hint: Enter the number of months you want to extend your project by.

pcr-add-partner-role-and-organisation.validation-message: You cannot change this information after you continue.
pcr-add-partner-role-and-organisation.organisation-type-info:
**Business** - a business based in the UK or overseas.

 **Research** - higher education and organisations registered with Je-S.

 **Research and technology organisation (RTO)** - organisations which solely promote and conduct collaborative research and innovation.

 **Public sector, charity or non Je-S registered research organisation** - a not-for-profit public sector body or charity working on innovation, not registered with Je-S.
pcr-add-partner-role-and-organisation.organisation-type-hint: If the new partner's organisation type is not listed, contact your monitoring officer.

pcr-add-partner-state-aid-eligibility.guidance-state-aid: If we decide to award this organisation funding they must be eligible to receive State aid at the point of the award. If they are found to be ineligible, we will withdraw our offer.
pcr-add-partner-state-aid-eligibility.guidance-de-minimis:
The funding will be made as a de minimis grant. All organisations for a de minimis award must complete and upload a de minimis declaration. This states any and all de minimis awards (from any source of public funding) during the current and previous 2 fiscal years.

In order to minimise distortion of competition, the European Commission sets limits on how much assistance can be given without its prior approval, to organisations operating in a competitive market. There is a ceiling of €200,000 for all de minimis aid provided to any one organisation over a 3 fiscal year period.

The new organisation needs to declare any de minimis aid awarded to any other public funding body which requests it. They must also keep all documentation associated with the award for 10 years from the date the award is granted.
pcr-add-partner-state-aid-eligibility.guidance-non-aid-funding: This competition provides funding that is classed as non-aid. The new organisation should seek independent legal advice on what this means for them, before you complete this project change request. Non-aid is only granted to organisations which declare that they will not use the funding: * in any way which gives them selective economic or commercial advantage * in any other way which would determine the funding as State aid (opens in new window) as defined by the European Commission It is important to note that it is the activity they intend to perform in the project, which is assessed as eligible for non-aid, and not their organisation as an entity. If they are found to be exploiting the outputs from this project commercially or economically to gain a selective advantage in the market, we will withdraw our offer.

pcr-add-partner-award-rate.guidance: The maximum the new organisation can enter is based on their size, type of organisation and research category of the project, based on the Innovate UK general guidance for grant applicants (opens in new window). This will be reviewed by Innovate UK to ensure the project stays within the funding rules. The percentage applied for must reflect other funding received.

pcr-add-partner-project-location.project-location-guidance: Indicate where the majority of the work being done by this partner will take place.
pcr-add-partner-project-location.postcode-guidance: If this is not available, leave this blank.

pcr-add-partner-academic-costs.step-guidance: Enter this information from the completed Je-S form.
pcr-add-partner-academic-costs.tsb-label: This number is found at the top of the Je-S form
pcr-add-partner-academic-costs.costs-guidance: Enter the figures from the summary of resources section of the Je-S form.

pcr-add-partner-academic-organisation.hint: Enter the name of the organisation that you work for.

pcr-add-partner-company-house.hint: Enter your organisation name or registration number
pcr-add-partner-company-house.result-not-showing: Is your organisation not showing in these results? Check your spelling, or try searching again using a more specific company name or the registration number.

pcr-add-partner-project-contacts.guidance: This information will be used to create an account for this person in the Innovation Funding Service.
pcr-add-partner-project-contacts.use-finance-details: Use the same details as the finance contact
pcr-add-partner-project-contacts.phone-number-hint: We may use this to contact the partner for more information about this request.

pcr-add-partner-finance-details.hint-year-end: This is the end of the last financial year for which you have your turnover.

pcr-add-partner-jes.jes-introduction: Your new academic partner must apply for funding through the Je-S system. To find out more about the Je-S requirements and processes please go to:
pcr-add-partner-jes.jes-list-item-1-link-content: Guidance from Innovate UK for academics applying via the Je-S system (opens in a new window)
pcr-add-partner-jes.jes-website-link-content: Je-S website (opens in a new window)
pcr-add-partner-jes.jes-upload-support: Upload a pdf copy of the completed Je-S output form, once the new partner has a status of 'With Council'. If there is information outstanding or the partner is not at this status, your request will be rejected.

pcr-add-partner-organisation-details.guidance: This definition must include organisations that are part of the new partner organisation. That is, where the new partner organisation owns shares in another organisation or has shares owned by another organisation. Use the European Commission (EC) small to medium enterprise (SME) definition (opens in new window) for guidance.

pcr-add-partner-other-funding.guidance: Is the new partner receiving any other public sector funding for this project? This is important as other public sector support counts as part of the funding they can receive.
pcr-add-partner-other-funding.label-other-sources-question: Is the new partner receiving any other public sector funding for this project?

pcr-add-partner-other-funding-sources.guidance: Include all sources of funding the new partner is receiving on top of the funding they are claiming from Innovate UK. These will be taken into account when calculating the funding they will receive.

pcr-add-partner-agreement-to-pcr.guidance: You must upload copies of signed letters from all other project partners to show they have agreed to this change
pcr-add-partner-agreement-to-pcr.heading: Upload partner agreement

pcr-period-length-change.guidance:
The period length can be 3 months or 1 month. This request will affect all remaining periods of the project for all partners. It will also change:
* how your project's forecast is divided
* how often your project submits a claim.



We will reject this if you submit it with any other request type.

pcr-reasoning-prepare-reasoning.hint:
You must explain each change. Be brief and write clearly.
If you are requesting a reallocation of project costs, you must justify each change to your costs.

pcr-prepare-item-files-for-partner-withd.guidance:
You must upload these documents:

* a confirmation letter on headed paper from the partner who is leaving, signed by someone with financial authority
* a brief list of the outstanding deliverables, and who each will be assigned to once the partner leaves
* copies of signed letters from all other project partners to show they have agreed to this change

pcr-remove-partner.hint-removal-period: The partner can make a claim for this period before being removed. If they have a claim in progress, they will be removed once that claim has been paid.

pcr-suspend-project-details.suspend-project-intro: You will not be able to perform any normal activities while this project is on hold, for example you cannot raise project change requests (PCR's), update forecasts, or create and submit claims.
pcr-suspend-project-details.last-day-of-pause-hint: This will happen on the last day of the month.

claims-messages.guidance-message: All partners in this project must upload evidence for each expenditure with every claim made. These might include invoices, timesheets, receipts or spreadsheets for capital usage. This is part of Innovate UK's obligations under the [Managing Public Money government handbook](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/managing-public-money?_ga=2.105018247.521318796.1576575366-1871284022.1544109966) in relation to assurance, financial management and control.

overdue-guidance-message.message-1: Further to previous notifications, the deadline for your final claims period has now passed. You can no longer submit claims for costs incurred or upload supporting documents.
overdue-guidance-message.message-2: If you have any queries, contact

claims-messages.submit-claim-confirmation: I confirm that the information I have provided in this claim is correct, complete and contains only eligible costs on an actual basis, which we confirm have been incurred and defrayed. I understand and accept that if I knowingly withhold information, or provide false or misleading information, this may result in my claim being rejected, termination of the contract, recovery of ineligible claims, civil action and where there is evidence of fraud, criminal prosecution.
claims-messages.no-open-claims: There are no open claims. The next claim period begins {{nextClaimStartDate}}.
claims-messages.no-closed-claims: There are no closed claims for this partner.
claims-messages.no-remaining-claims: There are no claims. Innovate UK has approved the final claims.
claims-messages.iar-required: You must attach an independent accountant's report (IAR) to this claim.
claims-messages.final-claim-guidance-content-1: We need to ask you a few questions about the project before we can make your last payment.
claims-messages.final-claim-guidance-content-2: You also need to upload an independent accountant's report (IAR).
claims-messages.final-claim-step-2: Download a copy from the survey website.
claims-messages.frequency-change-message: Your project asked us to change the length of the remaining periods. You must make sure your forecast reflects your expected spend or your monitoring officer will not approve your claim.
claims-messages.last-chance-to-change-forecast: This is your last chance to change the forecast for period {{periodId}}
claims-messages.document-detail-guidance: Evidence for each expenditure might include, but is not limited to, invoices, timesheets, receipts and spreadsheets for capital usage.
claims-messages.document-disclaimer-message: Do not remove any documents for previous months' costs.
claims-messages.interim-claim-message:
When adding costs for last month, you must:

* use a new line for every cost each month

* name the month in the description

* not alter any information for previous months' costs
claims-messages.edit-claim-line-item-guidance: You must break down your total costs and upload evidence for each expenditure you are claiming for. Contact your monitoring officer for more information about the level of detail you are required to provide.
claims-messages.edit-claim-line-item-convert-gbp: You can enter up to 120 separate lines of costs and you must convert any foreign currency amounts to pounds sterling (GBP) before you enter them into your claim.
claims-messages.edit-claim-line-item-document-guidance: Upload evidence of the costs for your monitoring officer to review. If you do not upload documents your monitoring officer is unlikely to accept your claim. Contact them for advice on which documents to provide.
claims-messages.negative-claim-warning: You have entered negative values for the following items:
claims-messages.claim-summary-warning: You have entered a negative claim for this period. Click 'Edit costs to be claimed' button if you wish to change this.

labour.rate-hint: This should be calculated from the number of working days for this role per year.
labour.days-spent-on-project: Days to be spent by all staff with this role
labour.total-cost-hint: Total cost will update when saved.

overheads.calculated-cost: Total cost of overheads as calculated in the spreadsheet (£)

subcontracting.subcontractor-country: Country where the subcontractor will work
subcontracting.subcontractor-role-and-description: Role of the the subcontractor in the project and description of the work they will do

capital-usage.net-present-value-hint: Either the current net present value or the price you bought it for
capital-usage.residual-value: Residual value at end of project (£)

travel-and-subs.description: Purpose of journey or desription of subsistence cost

other-costs.description: Description and justification of the cost

project-messages.setup-guidance: You need to give us some information so that we can complete project setup.  You will then be able to view your project and begin making claims.
project-messages.claimToSubmitMessage: You need to submit your claim.
project-messages.claimRequiresRequiresIARMessage: You need to submit your IAR.
project-messages.pendingProject: You need to set up your project

spend-profile-messages.cost-guidance-labour:
The new partner will need to account for all labour costs as they occur. For example, there must be timesheets and payroll records. These must show the actual hours worked by individuals and paid by the organisation.
They can include the following labour costs, based on PAYE records:

* gross salary
* National Insurance
* company pension contribution
* life insurance
* other non-discretionary package costs

You cannot include:

* discretionary bonuses
* performance related payments of any kind

You may include the total number of working days for staff but do not include:

* sick days
* waiting time
* training days
* non-productive time

List the total days worked by all categories of staff on the project. Describe their roles.

We will review the total amount of time and cost of labour before we approve this request. The terms and conditions of the grant include compliance with these points.
spend-profile-messages.cost-guidance-overheads:
You may claim for no overhead costs or 20% of your labour costs without providing any further supporting documentation or calculations. Actual costs can be claimed up to a maximum of the calculated figure.


If you feel your overheads are higher than 20% you may calculate a value using the Innovate UK model in the spreadsheet available below. The model shows you which types of indirect costs associated with your project you may claim. For support with this option, please contact our Customer Support Service on 0300 321 4357. Any value claimed under this model will be subject to a review. This will assess the appropriateness of your claim if your grant application is successful.
spend-profile-messages.cost-guidance-materials:
You can claim the costs of materials used on your project providing:

*  they are not already purchased or included in the overheads
*  they are purchased from third parties
*  they won’t have a residual/resale value at the end of your project. If they do you can claim the costs minus this value

Materials supplied by associated companies or project partners should be charged at cost.

Software that you have purchased specifically for use during your project may be included. If you already own the software then only additional costs which are incurred and paid during your project, will be eligible. For example, installation, training or customisation.

Material costs must be itemised to justify that they are eligible.
spend-profile-messages.cost-guidance-subcontracting:
You can subcontract work if you don’t have the expertise in your project team. You can also subcontract if it is cheaper than developing your skills in-house.

Subcontracting costs relate to work carried out by third party organisations. These organisations are not part of your project.

Subcontracting is eligible providing it is justified as to why the work cannot be performed by a project partner.

Subcontracting associate companies should be charged at cost.

Where possible you should select a UK based contractor. You should name the subcontractor (where known) and describe what they will be doing. You should also state where the work will be undertaken. We will look at the size of this contribution when assessing your eligibility and level of support.
spend-profile-messages.cost-guidance-capital-usage:
You can claim the usage costs of capital assets you will buy for, or use on, your project.

You will need to calculate a ‘usage’ value for each item. You can do this by deducting its expected value from its original price at the end of your project. If you owned the equipment before the project started then you should use its net present value.

This value is then multiplied by the amount, in percentages, that is used during the project. This final value represents the eligible cost to your project.
spend-profile-messages.cost-guidance-travel-and-subs:
Include all travel and subsistence costs that relate to this project. Be specific and add each item separately.

You can claim reasonable travel and subsistence costs for those individuals identified in the labour table. Costs must be necessary and be solely for the progression of your project.

Travel costs must be at economy travel only. State the reason for travel, number of people travelling, mode of transport, cost per trip and number of trips.

Provide full details and the purpose for any subsistence expenditure, including the number of staff involved.
spend-profile-messages.cost-guidance-other-costs:
This category can be used for any direct project costs which are not covered in the other categories. Examples of other costs include:

#### Workshop/laboratory usage charge outs
Costs relating to workshops or laboratories that can be identified specifically as directly attributable to the project can be claimed in this section.

You should provide details of how the workshop or laboratory charge out rates are calculated per hour/day. This can include specific labour (such as staff permanently in place to maintain and run the workshop or laboratory and not considered project specific), rent, rates, maintenance and equipment calibration costs. These should form the overall costs together with the available operational hours to inform the hourly/daily charge out rates. Each workshop or laboratory will need to be supported with actual usage data to claim costs.

#### Training costs
These costs are eligible where they are specific to and necessary for your project. We may consider support for management training specific to your project but will not support ongoing training.

#### Preparation of technical reports
Project costs related to technical reports may be eligible for example where the main aim of your project is the support of standards or technology transfer. You should show how this report is above and beyond what good project management would produce.

#### Market assessment
There is some scope for support of market assessment studies to help understand how your project results are applicable to the intended market. Market research as a promotional tool is ineligible.

#### Licensing in new technologies
We may consider support where we deem it makes sense to do so, for example, to avoid ‘reinventing the wheel’. If imported technology makes up a large part of your project (which is technology valued at more than £100,000) then we expect the development of that technology as part of your project.

#### Patent filing costs for new intellectual property (IP)
IP costs generated by your project are eligible. This cost is allowable for SMEs up to a limit of £7,500 per partner. These should not include legal costs relating to the filing of trademark related expenditure as these are considered to be marketing/exploitation costs and therefore ineligible.

Regulatory compliance costs are eligible if necessary to carry out your project. Project audit and accountancy feeds are not eligible.
spend-profile-messages.calculated-guidance-overheads: You will need to submit an overheads calculation spreadsheet, available following the link below, if the new partner feels their overheads are higher than 20%.

forecasts-messages.warning-period-change: Your project asked us to change the length of the remaining periods. Make sure your forecast is correct before submitting your next claim.
forecasts-messages.project-ended: You cannot change your forecast. Your project has ended.

monitoring-reports-messages.additionalCommentsGuidance: If you want to explain anything to Innovate UK, add it here.
monitoring-reports-messages.reportsSubmissionGuidance: You should submit reports for this project according to the schedule agreed with Innovate UK.
monitoring-reports-messages.onDeleteMonitoringReportMessage: You have deleted the monitoring report.
monitoring-reports-messages.deletingMonitoringReportMessage: All the information in the report will be permanently removed.
monitoring-reports-messages.submittingMonitoringReportMessage: By submitting this report, you certify that from the project monitoring documents shown to you, this report represents your best opinion of the current progress of this project.

project-labels.percentageEligibleCostsClaimedLabel: Percentage of eligible costs claimed to date
project-labels.totalContractPrepayment: Total contract value paid in advance

partner-labels.company-number-hint: This is the registered organisation number.
partner-labels.sort-code-hint: Must be 6 digits long, for example: 311212.
partner-labels.account-number-hint: Must be between 6 and 8 digits long, for example: 15481965.

document-labels.filesUploadedSubtitle: All documents uploaded during this request will be shown here. All documents open in a new window.

document-messages.header:
You can upload up to 10 documents at a time. Each document must:

* be less than 10MB in file size
* have a unique file name that describes its contents

There is no limit to the number of files you can upload in total.
document-messages.infoTitle: What file types can I upload?
document-messages.infoContent:
You can upload these file types:

* PDF ({{pdfTypes}})
* text ({{textTypes}})
* presentation ({{presentationTypes}})
* spreadsheet ({{spreadsheetTypes}})
* image ({{imageTypes}})
document-messages.new-window: All documents open in new window.
document-messages.upload-instruction-1: You can upload and store any documents for this claim on this page.
document-messages.upload-instruction-2: You will also be able to see any documents added to the claim by the finance contact and Innovate UK.

documentsIntroMessage.storing-documents-message: This page is for storing most project-related supporting documents, including those uploaded by Innovate UK.
documentsIntroMessage.not-for-claims-message: Do not use this page for claims. You must only upload supporting documents for claims on the page where you review them.

financial-virement-labels.grant-moving-over-year: Grant value moving over the financial year end
financial-virement-labels.year-end-information: The financial year ends on March 31st.

pcr-add-partner-labels.commercial-work-label: Will the new partner's work on the project be mostly commercial or economic?
pcr-add-partner-labels.commercial-work-label-hint: This question applies to all organisations, including research organisations that normally act non-economically.
pcr-add-partner-labels.postcode-heading: Postcode, postal code or zip code
